data.prayer: Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict each believer in Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India to take up their calling as a priesthood of believers and pray for the 5,039,845 lost around them.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood

data.prayer: Spirit, help the 56,055 believers find a person of peace today among the 5,039,845 lost neighbors around them. And help them start discovery bible studies in these unbelieving homes.
data.verse: Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor. Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.’ So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us.”

data.prayer: God, we pray both the men and women of Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India will find ways to meet in groups of two or three to encourage and correct one another from your Word.
Jesus, I pray that all the Sabakhia people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Sabakhia people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Sabakhia people is yours.
Spirit, give the disciples of the the county of Purba Medinipur words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.prayer: Spirit, make the church in Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India humble and willing to hear the sometimes hard voices of prophets bringing the light of truth on them.
data.verse: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

data.prayer: Father, you desire to blot out the sins of the people of Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India. You said, if they turn to you, you will dissolve their sins like mist.
data.verse: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

location.name: Purba Medinipur
location.people_groups_list: Nai (Hindu traditions), Kurunga, Bhathiara (Hindu traditions), Mangali, Mahuria
